Former PM Gabriel Attal wants to make his mark with a  name change for Macron's Renaissance party
description: Gabriel Attal, former prime minister and current head of Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party, sent questions to Renaissance members on July 31 about the party's future and name, as a way to redefine its identity and shape it to suit him ahead of the 2027 presidential election.

headline: Pope Leo XIV welcomes hundreds of thousands of young Catholics to Rome for the Holy Year youth festival
description: The pope urged the young Catholics, hailing from nearly 150 countries, to value true friendship and to do good in the world: 'Friendship is a path to peace.' Though 500,000 attendees were initially expected, the final count could reach up to one million.

headline: In 'Chief of War,' Jason Momoa reigns over a Hawaiian tragedy
description: The actor who gained fame in 'Game of Thrones' is behind this surprising historical series that chronicles the unification of the Hawaiian archipelago and the arrival of foreign powers.

headline: 'In Germany, the punks made music to express themselves': Mark Reeder, an avant-garde night owl
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (6/6). In the late 1970s, as English pop dominated the world, Mark Reeder instead swore by German electronic music. He left his native Manchester at 20 to discover Berlin, its clubs and its music.

description: Washington has wielded the threat of 50% tariffs against Brazil to influence the Brazilian judiciary, condemning what it calls a 'witch hunt' against former far-right President Jair Bolsonaro.

headline: Trial ordered for deadly 1982 attack on Paris Jewish restaurant
description: Two alleged members of a Palestinian militant group will stand trial in Paris over the attack that killed six in a restaurant in the city’s historic Marais district. Four other suspects remain under arrest warrants.

description: In a French prison, Samy R. became a specialist in supplying his fellow inmates with all kinds of goods by corrupting the guards.
